ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A working knowledge of French grammar, improved vocabulary and speaking/listening skills. Also I can kind of read French books now!

I developed a better sense of how to use various verb tenses and moods, and I became much more secure in conjugating different types of unfamiliar verbs too. I gained a valuable insight into a variety of interesting pieces of French literature and film.

Taking this course, I developed intensive language skills in both oral, and written French. My French communication skills have greatly improved over the course of the semester as a result of learning the course content.
My French writing, reading and listening improved significantly.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths - very easy to keep engaged/motivated, could see my work paying off which was super satisfying. Weaknesses - very assessment-heavy, depressing content (suicide, abandonment, death, murder, abuse) which is fine to read about but a warning would have been nice (I eventually had to resort to looking up wikipedia synopses before reading books to be prepared)

The strength of this section is certainly Mme Koizim's teaching. She cares very strongly for her students, and being in her section has undoubtedly helped me achieve a better grade on the course than I would have gotten otherwise. There is perhaps a slightly excessive workload for this class, but in general the work is still interesting and helps develop security with the language.

I believe one strengths of this course is the level of interaction that occurs between the professors and the students. Each student can expect to have a high level of interaction with the professor, and I feel this level of interaction benefited me greatly. Every day in class, I was always able to interact with the professor regarding any questions I had about the course material. One of the weaknesses of this class is that the class does meet everyday, and therefore has a very significant workload.

This subject is really well structured to build on concepts, and you do genuinely feel like your French is improving. My only recommendation would be to increase the emphasis on spoken French, in addition to reading, writing and listening.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! FREN 130 was such a formative experience for my first semester, especially with Mme Koizim (she's retiring after next semester though :( ) I had taken 3 years off from French before going into this class and was super worried about that affecting my performance, but she was so flexible and accomodating that after the first few weeks I really didn't have any problems integrating into L3.
I think this class is great for consolidating your understanding and use of French, so I would certainly recommend it to other students.
